sentence: We have abundant evidence to prove his guilt.

translation: daremny [(of actions) having no effect or achieving nothing]
sentence: All my attempts to cheer her up proved futile.

translation: zwracać uwagę (w znaczeniu brać do serca, traktować poważnie)
sentence: If only they had heeded his warnings!

translation: niewdzięcznik [literary; a person who is not grateful]
sentence: If you mean I am an ingrate, that is an unpleasant word, Aunt Mary.

translation: samotnik [a person who likes to do things on their own without other people]
sentence: He was always a loner at school.

translation: przyziemny [very ordinary and therefore not interesting]
sentence: Mundane matters such as paying bills and shopping for food do not interest her.
She kissed the nape of his neck.

translation: zdecydowany [formal; determined in character, action, or ideas]
sentence: Their resolute opposition to new working methods was difficult to overcome.

translation: student drugiego roku [a student studying in the second year of a course at a US college or high school]
sentence: Suzie was a sophomore the year I graduated.

translation: błahostki [details or information that are not important]
sentence: She has an encyclopedic knowledge of sports trivia.
The tunnel goes right underneath the city.

translation: wir [a mass of air or water that spins around very fast and pulls objects into its empty centre]
sentence: I was sucked into a vortex of despair.

translation: cudaczny [unusual and strange in a way that might be funny or annoying]
sentence: Despite his kindly, sometimes whimsical air, he was a shrewd observer of people.

translation: więdnąć [to become weak and dry and decay]
sentence: Grass had withered in the fields.
